title: Kansas City Style St. Louis Ribs

instructions.1: About one hour before smoking, coat both sides of ribs with a little vegetable oil and sprinkle with barbecue seasoning rub. Set aside at room temperature for 1 hour.
instructions.2: Heat charcoal or gas grill for indirect cooking at 230 to 250 degrees F. Add drained wood chips, if using.
instructions.3: Place the ribs, meaty side down, over a drip pan and cook for 2 hours. Add about 12 coals to a charcoal grill every 45 minutes or so to maintain the heat.
instructions.4: Remove ribs from grill. Double-wrap each rack in heavy-duty aluminum foil. Return wrapped ribs to the grill and cook for 1 1/2 to 3 hours more over indirect heat, until very tender. Add more coals as needed to maintain temperature for a charcoal grill.
instructions.5: Meanwhile, make the sauce. Combine all ingredients in small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
instructions.6: Remove ribs from grill and unwrap. Place ribs over direct heat on grill and brush with Kansas City-style barbecue sauce. Cook for about 5 minutes until the sauce is set. Turn ribs and repeat with more sauce.

questions.question: In Step 3, is the ribs from Step 1 being used?
Is ribs from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is grill from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is more coals from Step 4 still available in Step 5?
Is indirect cooking live after Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 6?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to place the ribs in Step 3?
Can we smoke (Step 1) and heat (Step 2) at the same time?
